body_html:
Does it work in tf nightlies?
…
On Wed, Oct 11, 2017 at 2:26 PM, nitaidean ***@***.***> wrote: I tried using top_k on multiple GPU's using TensorFlow 1.3.0, and it failed with this message: *Cannot assign a device for operation 'gradients/TopKV2_grad/sub_1': Could not satisfy explicit device specification '/device:GPU:0' because no supported kernel for GPU devices is available.* This suggests to me that top_k still does not have GPU kernel support, and hence must still run on the CPU. But this thread mentioned that the problem had been solved by @ebrevdo <https://github.com/ebrevdo> back in 1.3.0rc0. Did I misunderstand? — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#5719 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABtim3Qc38Gk8PCKhoQ7tcpe-sQz0ieyks5srTKTgaJpZM4K3RGK> .
body_text:
Does it work in tf nightlies?
…
On Wed, Oct 11, 2017 at 2:26 PM, nitaidean ***@***.***> wrote:
 I tried using top_k on multiple GPU's using TensorFlow 1.3.0, and it
 failed with this message:

 *Cannot assign a device for operation 'gradients/TopKV2_grad/sub_1': Could
 not satisfy explicit device specification '/device:GPU:0' because no
 supported kernel for GPU devices is available.*

 This suggests to me that top_k still does not have GPU kernel support, and
 hence must still run on the CPU. But this thread mentioned that the problem
 had been solved by @ebrevdo <https://github.com/ebrevdo> back in
 1.3.0rc0. Did I misunderstand?

 —
 You are receiving this because you were mentioned.

body:
Does it work in tf nightlies?

On Wed, Oct 11, 2017 at 2:26 PM, nitaidean <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> I tried using top_k on multiple GPU's using TensorFlow 1.3.0, and it
> failed with this message:
>
> *Cannot assign a device for operation 'gradients/TopKV2_grad/sub_1': Could
> not satisfy explicit device specification '/device:GPU:0' because no
> supported kernel for GPU devices is available.*
>
> This suggests to me that top_k still does not have GPU kernel support, and
> hence must still run on the CPU. But this thread mentioned that the problem
> had been solved by @ebrevdo <https://github.com/ebrevdo> back in
> 1.3.0rc0. Did I misunderstand?
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
